Author: HUSSY.io
Title: [ANN][HUS] HUSSY.io ♥️ disrupting the sex work industry ♥️
Body: Unfortunately you are right -- we are legally able to operate the listing platform only in some countries that decriminalized or legalized the sex work. These are the countries that we will target in the first phase of the project. This market includes most of EU countries.  However, since the underlying infrastrcture will be decentralized and highly flexible, someone who isn't us can open a listing platform anonymously in any country (for example behind a Tor gateway) on top of the infrastructure that we legally deploy in EU.  Here is a nice overview of some other features: https://bitcoinist.com/hussy-io-blockchain-sex-work-industry/

Author: HUSSY.io
Title: [ANN][HUS] HUSSY.io ♥️ disrupting the sex work industry ♥️
Body: - "i am not sure if investors will be attracted by the features of a new project like this hussy" -- You can't be sure about that in pretty much any ICO. The important thing is however, that we believe in this project and we do our best to deliver what we promised.  - "are sex workers will undergo KYC verification and will need to check if they are safe from std's? I am just curious how this can be implemented and if sex workers will allow to undergo this requirements." -- In countries with legal sex work (e.g. Austria), all sex workers are already registered on police department and have to take regular health checks. However the big problem with the status quo is, that the parties involved in the sex trade cannot easily verify each other without disclosing their identities. With our solution, both parties can easily and anonymously verify each other before providing of the service.  For implementation details, I recommend the whitepaper - there is a very detailed technical description.   Quote from: cammie16 on May 20, 2018, 01:43:37 PM Some projects before that also have some related features like this did not succeed because of some reasons. I am wondering now what the team will do if ever they did not reach the soft cap? Because this kind of project is not really easy to advertise and promote in all social medias.  - "Some projects ... did not succeed because of some reasons" -- That's a cute sentence Firstly, please specify which projects are you exactly talking about and then we can analyze the reasons why they failed. There have been several very successful Blockchain-based projects in adult industry.  - "I am wondering now what the team will do if ever they did not reach the soft cap?". -- In case the soft cap is not reached, all funds collected during the public sale will be returned to the backers.  - "Because this kind of project is not really easy to advertise and promote in all social medias." -- It's not easy, but not impossible. We can use mainstream social media, we just can't post any sexually explicit content there.

Author: HUSSY.io
Title: [ANN][HUS] HUSSY.io ♥️ disrupting the sex work industry ♥️
Body: HUSSY.io is a distributed escorting and due diligence infrastructure. The value proposition is to create a platform and to provide incentives for sex workers around the globe for safe execution of their profession.  ★ Website ★ Pitch deck ★ Whitepaper ★ Twitter ★ Facebook ★ Reddit ★ Telegram ★ Medium ★ Instagram ★ GitHub ★     ☞ Main features ☜  .............................................................................   ............................................................................... .............. Due diligence   Listings platform - anonymized but verifiable KYC compliance   - flexible fee schedule based on Raiden network - professional health certification   - security deposits for clients on the Blockchain to avoid time-wasting clients that arrange a meeting but never arrive - Proof of Consent stored on the Blockchain[/b]   - utilization of machine learning in order to find the near-optimal fees strategy for a given time and location .............................................................................   ............................................................................... ..............   Open to 3rd party platforms HUSSY is not just another another escorting platform, but rather a whole escorting infrastructure. We are legally able to operate our own escorting platform only in selected countries, however anyone can open their own escorting platform anonymously in any country and join the distributed HUSSY infrastructure in order to improve the status quo of the global sex work industry.  Impossible to shut down Decentralized nature of the HUSSY infrastructure makes it near impossible to shut down. Our solution is resistant to regulations like FOSTA / SESTA and anyone can open a new listing platform using the HUSSY infrastructure. Only the data owners are in control of their data, nobody else is able to delete or modify the data — not even us, not even the listing platforms and not even the law enforcement.  No time-wasting or abusive clients Clients are incentivized to make a security deposit before arranging a meeting. In case of an inappropriate or abusive behaviour, the client risks losing of his deposit. Furthermore, service providers may require a client to make a booking deposit in order to filter out time-wasting clients that make a reservation but never appears on a meeting.     ☞ Technical overview ☜    ☞ Listings platform ☜   ☞ Flexible fee schedule ☜ Monetizing of listing platforms is based on a fair advertising fees that are updated according to demand for sex services in a given time and location. Every service provider can choose an optional fee for a listing — the higher the fee, the more often will be the offer shown to potential clients. We will utilize machine learning in order to suggest an optimal and fair advertising fees according to demand for sex services in a given time and location. Recurrent micropayments will be carried out through Raiden.     ☞ Roadmap ☜   ☞ About us ☜ HUSSY OÜ (registry code: 1313837) Harju maakond, Kuusalu vald, Pudisoo küla, Männimäe, 74626, Estonia  Team members   We are hiring! Drop us a message at team[at]hussy.io.  Advisory board   ☞ Crowdsourcing campaign ☜ Crowdsale fundraising goals are given in terms of soft cap (lower limit) and hard cap (upper limit). The crowdsale is considered as successful once the soft cap has been reached. In case of unsuccessful token sale, all funds collected during the public sale are returned to backers. Total number of 100,000,000 HUS tokens have been issued. The token is sold in two phases – private (10,000,000 HUS including bonuses) and public (50,000,000 HUS). All unsold tokens will be burned. More information and enquiries at info[at]hussy.io or through our social media.  Soft cap: $2,000,000 Hard cap: $20,000,000 Target token price: 1 HUS = $0.36

Author: HUSSY.io
Title: [ANN][HUS] HUSSY.io ♥️ disrupting the sex work industry ♥️
Body: Thanks for your questions. I'll answer them below one by one.  > Your hardcap of 20 million dollars? Yes, this is correct.  > Are you developing your own blockchain? No, we are utilizing an existing Blockchain -- namely, the Ethereum Blockchain.  > Why so much money? The breakdown of collected funds as described in our whitepaper is the following: - Development 30% - Marketing 20% - Acquisitions and mergers 20% - Reserve 20% - Legal 5% - Administrative 5%  According to our 3-year projection, $20M hard cap should be sufficient to reasonably operate an SME with 25-50 full-time employees and offices in 3 countries until we start to generate enough revenue for further expansion.

The utility token will not be used to mediate payments between clients and the service providers in our platform (this could be classified as a *procuring of sexual services* or *pimping*). It will only be used for mediating payments for advertisement and security deposits for additional trust.   Quote from: jaksone on May 19, 2018, 09:52:01 AM The regulatory platform of sex workers in every country is not the same let alone country on culture and custom eastern who in fact consider this is very inappropriate to talk about ... is there any other solution?  We will operate our own listing platform only in selected countries. However, since the infrastructure is open, any existing or future listing platform can join. In this case, the regulatory and cultural compliance fully depends on the listing platform. We believe, that the sex is the most natural activity any humans can engage in. Moral biases and social stigma makes the work of many sex workers very difficult. Although this topic may be uncomfortable for some people to discuss about, only an open discussion about this topic may improve the status quo.
